edu.stanford.math.plex4.metric.utility

Class MetricUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.metric.utility.MetricUtility

  • public class MetricUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains various functions for dealing with metric spaces.
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz

    • Method Detail

      • estimateDiameter

        public static double estimateDiameter(AbstractIntMetricSpace metricSpace,
                      int trials)
        This function estimates the diameter of the supplied metric space. The diameter is defined as the smallest number r such that d(x, y) <= r for all x, y in the space. The estimate is obtained by randomly choosing pairs (i, j), and taking the maximum distance over all pairs.
        Parameters:
        metricSpace - the metric space to estimate the diameter of
        trials - the number of random pairs to choose
        Returns:
        an estimate of the diameter of the metric space

      • estimateDiameter

        public static double estimateDiameter(AbstractIntMetricSpace metricSpace)
        This function performs randomized sampling to find the estimated diameter of the given metric space. It uses a default number of samples equal to 100.
        Parameters:
        metricSpace - the metric space to estimate the diameter of
        Returns:
        an estimate of the diameter of the metric space

      • computeMaxima

        public static double[] computeMaxima(AbstractObjectMetricSpace<double[]> metricSpace)
        This function computes the coordinate-wise maxima of a given Euclidean metric space.
        Parameters:
        metricSpace - the metric space to compute the maxima for
        Returns:
        the componentwise minima of the elements of the metric space

      • computeMinima

        public static double[] computeMinima(AbstractObjectMetricSpace<double[]> metricSpace)
        This function computes the coordinate-wise minima of a given Euclidean metric space.
        Parameters:
        metricSpace - the metric space to compute the minima for
        Returns:
        the componentwise minima of the elements of the metric space

      • computeCentroid

        public static double[] computeCentroid(AbstractObjectMetricSpace<double[]> metricSpace)
        This function computes the centroid of the set of points within the metric space.
        Parameters:
        metricSpace - the metric space to compute the centroid of
        Returns:
        the centroid of the given metric space
